abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Guiyang Transport
            Project for China were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            in general, the improvement of accessibility and mobility
            should be measured by corridor traffic and travel time. At
            appraisal, the project's development objectives (PDO)
            monitoring was not well arranged. During implementation, the
            Guiyang project management office (GPMO) monitored the
            indicators inconsistently with some initial delays:
            different approaches were used (variability in sampling
            method) from one report to another and traffic counts were
            not collected and processed professionally. Approval and
            provision of additional funding for the project after
            restructuring took time, which contributed to implementation
            delays. Future engagements should place greater emphasis on
            development and review of project feasibility studies,
            investigation of any relevant government policies,
            construction industry related market studies, and improved
            coordination with resettlement document preparation and
            activities. Related to the bus terminals, governments at
            both municipal and county levels need to develop a proper
            strategy and policy, apply adequate regulation and
            management, and provide sufficient support to the operation
            and maintenance.

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Guiyang Transport
            Project for China is to increase the access and mobility of
            Guiyang Municipality's transport users through priority
            infrastructure investments while establishing more
            sustainable mechanisms for rural road maintenance, as well
            as enhancing capacity for keeping municipal debt under
            control. The changes relate to: (i) an extension of closing
            date of the Loan by 12 months, from the original December
            31, 2012 to December 31, 2013; (ii) reallocation of Loan
            proceeds and increase of disbursement percentage; and (iii)
            addition of a legal covenant to enable the Bank to monitor,
            more efficiently, the activities related to resettlement,
            until completion.

display_title.display_title:
China - Guiyang Transport Project
            : restructuring : Main report

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Guiyang Transport
            Project for China is to increase the access and mobility of
            Guiyang Municipality's transport users through priority
            infrastructure investments while establishing more
            sustainable mechanisms for rural road maintenance, as well
            as enhancing capacity for keeping municipal debt under
            control. The changes relate to: (i) the scope of one
            component of the project, part B - Rural Transport, which
            will be reduced; (ii) the institutional change for the
            implementation of the remaining part of rural transport
            component; (iii) reallocation of the Loan proceeds; and (iv)
            adjustment of the result indicators for the rural transport component.

display_title.display_title:

            : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
